name: Les Messugues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to visit Saint Paul, and the hotel is a few minutes walk from the ramparts. Friendly atmosphere, very nice oval pool area with a bar service and lunch. Nice room with terracce looking out on the garden, air conditioned. Breakfast was good. Just what we were looking for even though we stayed only for one night this time. Also a great location for excursions in the region.
reviews.title: Excellent location in Saint Paul de Vence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel near the walls of St Paul de Vencd. Beautiful environment, pleasant and familiar. Great area lasers with beautiful pool.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 days of absolute bliss at this hotel,will be returning soon,rooms were beautiful,pool and grounds pristine -a truly provencal ambience-dont miss this one its lovely.
reviews.title: paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stunning hotel and location which really makes you feel comfortable the moment you see it...we stayed on our honeymoon and loved the feel of the hotel and wondered down to the hillside town every nite to have drinks at le terrace and watch the locals play boules each nite...loved it
reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon

reviews.text: Our French Companion said their were lots of nice places around St Paul, and in this case he was right. We arrived late without a booking and wanting 2 rooms, the lady that received us was brusque at first, but soon warmed and offered a package for 2 rooms for the night. both rooms were very comfortable, with little things like heated towel racks and firm and soft pillows. As it was late she showed us the breakfast kitchenette in the lobby, and just to make a note of any tea, coffee or beer wine or spirits we drank and tell the counter in the morning. Next morning a classic french breakfast with great coffee and bread and fruit. We walked around the pool and gardens,it seems a great place for a 2or 3 night stay, comfortable lounge with free computer or WiFi. The only thing I will never get used to in France is Pets everywhere in hotels, restaurants wherever. At least they have segregated the smokers.
reviews.title: A welcome relief after a long drive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to this hotel after several years. The gardens have grown and become even more delightful and colourful and the swimming pool and area are also a delight with lovely shaded areas to sit on raised decking and other lovely little niches so you don't have to be on top of others. The bedrooms are clean, comfortable and adequate with, in our case a deluxe room, a nice balcony with table and chairs and the bathrooms are a good standard. However the televisions are very small and contrary to what is advertised the satellite is limited to 15 French channels with no news channels in French or English. or any language. You can however receive wi/fi in your room. For the price of a deluxe room, now from 140 euros without breakfast, the television is not really good enough if you are staying for several days. Also the facilities in the room, eg the very small soap bar for several days, small towels and other thoughtful extras for travellers, are just not there and at this price, they should be.
reviews.title: Lovely setting but too many serious faults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortuantely we found fleas in the room, we saw them, and it is no exaggeration to state that we together, received about 50 bites a night. Because of the dismissive attitude when we mentioned the mouse dropping (see below) we decided it not worth mentioning at the time but to report later.
reviews.title: Charming & quaint with a lovely pool and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is quite expensive enough and after several days quite monotinous. The breads and pastries are very fresh. We felt that the juices and cold meats and the fruit salads particularly were churned over from day to day and not always fresh. A bit concerning.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel near St Paul de Vence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our main problem was with the pool cafe. We found a mouse dropping in the teapot which we did not discover until it appeared in the cup ,which we found most disconcerting as it was after we had drunk most of it.. As the cafe is in an outside separate building this is entirely possible and rodents can easily climb in and out, but care should be taken over this. When we mentioned it diplomatically and quietly, it was dismissed as dust and thrown to the ground and stamped upon, so that we could no longer comment nor identify the dropping. The next day we decided not to eat there again as apart from this, some things seemed to be prepared and stored badly, and so we took a small baguette to the sunbed and ate it quietly with a drink under the trees. A lady advanced upon us and in a very impolite manner and with minutes of rude banter (all in French, I hasten to add we spoke French all the time), we were told to eat nothing at the pool unless we used the cafe, in spite of our experience the day before, they paid no heed to this nor apologised but from then on treated us dismissively. One would have though they could have been a little embarrassed and would have understood that we would prefer to eat our own food. By that token you could not even eat a sweet or biscuit or have a bottle of water by the pool. There is no notice to say this, but it would appear that a petty stance had been taken.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel and wonderful service

reviews.text: Also the last British Airways flight lands at 1130 at night so we asked if this was alright and were told to ring on landing and then collect the car and drive on up at our leisure. We did this and were greeted by the same lady (who told us not to eat at the pool later), and she was not happy with our late arrival and made it very plain. So, sadly this is not going to be a hotel we would return to, nor recommend. It has so much going for it, but at the moment the family presence is very obvious and does seem to take over their lives so that guests can seem a bit of a bore. We wanted to love it but things need to improve, especially as there are no restaurants/cafes nearby or shops to buy daily requirements, and if they are not too friendly, this could soon start to affect their business and it is not that marvellous that they can afford to get away with it with the euro as it is and the general cost of things. The hotel is in such a perfect quiet setting (no view just vineyards) that they should not become complacent. It should be the perfect answer to a blissful break away from the humid coast, in such toal tranquility but it is failing and it is a real shame.
reviews.title: The most wonderful Hotel in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the Title, you can tell that the Owners were very helpful and knowledgeable, willing to share and very approachable.
reviews.title: Thanks to the Owners, We Visited Gourdon As Well!

reviews.text: We stayed in a Vineyard View Room which had a balcony that opened up to the breeze that carried the raw smell of the Vineyard. We loved it! Both the bedroom and bathroom are very spacious, especially love the big tub!
reviews.title: A wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a shortcut route connecting the hotel to the village, and we had a very memorable dinner at a restaurant recommended by the Owners. Torchlights are also provided.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in lovely St Paul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the breakfast by the hotel's garden, and it was nice to take a short walk along the garden to the pool. Yes, there is also a small pool for use.
reviews.title: charm and peace near lovely St. Paul de vence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though the Owners were doing housekeeping, but they were kind to take a break and help us take a photo in our room. How kind! The greatest part of this stay was the tip to visit Gourdon, high above the hills, and check out the view of Cote d'Azur from there.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!
